ovdesc.p: This table will be used to hold the various parameters for the different tax form types.

desc.p: ID of Tax Form needed for IRS.
Max 16 Alphanumeric character
Description of the Tax Form.
Max 35 Alphanumeric character.
The underlying file from which the data of the fields are to be referenced for mapping the ID for the tax table are defined here.
The allowable drop down values are STMT.ENTRY,RE.CONSOL.SPEC.ENTRY,USREGS.IRS.TAX.DETAILS
This field will have the EB.SYSTEM.ID of the transaction.
This is an optional field and need to be defined only if different mapping of ID fields are to be done depending on the main application.
EX: If the ID of Tax reporting contains the loan reference then the TXN.REFERENCE can be directly mapped for EB.SYSTEM.ID “LD” for STMT.ENTRY raised from LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS
In case of STMT.ENTRY raised from PD.PAYMENT.DUE only part of the TXN.REFERENCE need to be mapped to get the loan reference.
Hence this can be achieved by the combination of SYSTEM.ID as “PD“and ID.STMT.FLD with an extract function.
Max 6 Alphanumeric character.
This field is to be used to define the field mapping from the underlying base table to form the id of the Tax Form database.
The default id of the tax form database is the customer No.
If tax reporting has to be done on contract level rather than customer level then this functionality can be used.
This field support Extract function.
Max 20 Alphanumeric character.
This field is used to attach user defined routine If complex level of id mapping.
It should be always taken care that the first part of the id should always be a valid customer No.
Max 35 Alphanumeric character
This field defines the tax Amount code which has to contain the financial information like year to date interest or year to tax with held.
Max 35 Alphanumeric character
This field describes the amount code like INT.INCOME.
This field is used to map the Transaction codes to the particular tax Amount code.
This field along with 9 and 10 fields is used to define the transactions that needs to be accumulated to the Tax form Box.
Example – If the credit interest from account has to be captured then the transaction code 381 has to mapped here.
Max 4 Numeric character
If a particular transaction code originating from a specific module only has to be mapped then define the EB.SYSTEM.ID of the particular application here.
Max 6 Alphanumeric character.
If extra conditions has to be built to decide if a transaction entry,
with a specific transaction code has to be captured into a specific tax Box form then the routine has to be specified here.
Max 35 Alphanumeric character
This restricts the data capture for specific categories.
If a particular form needs to mapped from only certain products then the category code for the product can be specified here.
This is an optional field.
Max 6 Numeric character.
Minimum Amount for which the transaction will be considered.
AMOUNT field.
Max 19 Numeric character
Shows the residence details which are to be excluded from the IRS processing
Max 4 Alpha character
Shows the sector codes which are to be excluded from the year-end tax reporting process
Max 5 Numeric character
The application allows conditional reporting only based on category.
If additional conditions needs to be done then this can be catered using the condition routine API.
The condition routine is triggered before id mapping and transaction mapping.
Max 35 Alphanumeric character
All account interest capitalization accounting entries would have the booking date and value date different in T24.
This is because even though the interest capitalization was booked on cob
the value date has to be the next date since the value dated balances for accounts has to get reflected only on the next day.
Hence this functionality would allow the user to specify that the interest needs to be updated to the previous day (value date – 1) in the tax database.
The filed format is sign:no:(C or w) . e.g. -1C .
This field is really crucial in cases of cross year reposting.
If the valued date is not adjusted then the entry may be reported on the next year instead of the previous year.
AMOUNT Field
Max 19 Alphanumeric character
This filed is the associated field to VDATE.ADJUST.
All the transactions dates that need to follow the adjust value date should be specified here.
